p: Therefore, OC can be classified according to its clinical aspects such as the presence or absence of desquamated epithelial cells, angular cheilitis, gingival erythema, and presence of necrotic material [ 6, 12]. Thus, OC presents two classifications, (i) pseudomembranous OC, which is characterized by white lesions, foul breath, and hyperplasic candidiasis and (ii) erythematous OC, which presents red lesions, and acute or chronic atrophic candidiasis [ 12].
